comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This unveiling was on Saturday 22 October 1938. It is the Flinders and Bass Memorial Flagpole. The man with his hand on the flag and unveiling a bronze tablet is either Mr. K. R. Cramp, President of the Royal Australian Historical Society or the Minister for Lands, Mr. Sinclair. Here's the report in the following Monday's Sydney Morning Herald: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article17530599

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Here's a picture of Minister for Lands, Colin Sinclair The donor of the land, E. J. Coote of Bellevue Hill, was Edmund Coote, co-founder of Angus & Coote Jewellers.

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content:
I can't positively identify Mr. Sinclair in the group of three at left.

What do you think, pellethepoet?

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: My initial thought was the figure at the left of the group - but he could be any of them. Although in the portrait he is balding, we don't know if it pre- or proceeded this.
